places.name: DY Patil Stadium
places.description: A state-of-the-art cricket stadium that hosts IPL matches and other sporting events.

places.name: Central Park
places.description: A large urban park with walking paths, gardens, and recreational facilities.

places.name: Wonders Park
places.description: A theme park with miniature replicas of world-famous monuments and attractions.

places.name: NMMC Butterfly Garden
places.description: A specialized garden that attracts various butterfly species with plants that serve as food sources.

places.name: Pandavkada Falls
places.description: A scenic waterfall that comes alive during the monsoon season, offering beautiful views.

places.name: Gateway of India
places.description: The iconic arch monument built during the British Raj, situated on the waterfront of Mumbai harbor.

places.name: Marine Drive
places.description: A 3.6-kilometer-long boulevard that curves along the coastline of Mumbai's Back Bay, also known as the Queen's Necklace.

places.name: Ajanta Caves
places.description: Ancient rock-cut Buddhist cave monuments dating from the 2nd century BCE to about 480 CE, designated UNESCO World Heritage Site.

places.name: Ellora Caves
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring Buddhist, Hindu and Jain rock-cut temples and monasteries built between the 6th and 10th century.

places.name: Mahabaleshwar
places.description: A serene hill station with panoramic viewpoints, lush green valleys, and famous strawberry farms.

places.name: Lonavala
places.description: A popular hill station known for its chikki (a traditional sweet), lookout points, and ancient caves.

places.name: Khandala
places.description: A scenic hill station with beautiful valleys, grasslands, and a pleasant climate throughout the year.

places.name: Bibi Ka Maqbara
places.description: Also known as the 'Tomb of the Lady', it's a mausoleum built by Aurangzeb's son in memory of his mother.

places.name: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple
places.description: A famous temple dedicated to Sai Baba, a spiritual master revered by both Hindu and Muslim devotees.

places.name: Raigad Fort
places.description: The historic fort that was the capital of Maratha king Shivaji Maharaj's kingdom, situated atop a hill.

places.name: Shree Siddhivinayak Temple
places.description: One of the most visited temples in Mumbai dedicated to Lord Ganesha, the remover of obstacles.

places.name: Alibaug Beach
places.description: A popular weekend getaway known for its beaches, historic sea fort, and coastal cuisine.

places.name: Ganpatipule Beach
places.description: A pristine beach with white sand and clear water, also home to a 400-year-old Ganpati temple.

places.name: Pratapgad Fort
places.description: A mountain fort known for the historic Battle of Pratapgad where Shivaji Maharaj defeated Afzal Khan.

places.name: Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve
places.description: Maharashtra's oldest and largest national park, known for its tiger population and rich biodiversity.

places.name: Elephanta Caves
places.description: Ancient cave temples on Elephanta Island dedicated to Lord Shiva, featuring spectacular stone sculptures.

places.name: Juhu Beach
places.description: One of Mumbai's most famous beaches known for its vibrant atmosphere, street food, and celebrity homes.

places.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and historic railway station known for its Victorian Gothic Revival architecture.

places.name: Kanheri Caves
places.description: Ancient Buddhist caves dating from the 1st century BCE to the 10th century CE, located within the Sanjay Gandhi National Park.

places.name: Tarkarli Beach
places.description: Known for its clear blue water and white sand, it's one of the best beaches for snorkeling and scuba diving in Maharashtra.

places.name: Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary
places.description: A biodiversity hotspot with rich flora and fauna, including the endangered Indian Giant Squirrel.

places.name: Bhimashankar Temple
places.description: One of the 12 Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva in India, located in the Sahyadri range.

places.name: Panchgani
places.description: A picturesque hill station known for its five hills, table land, and strawberry farms.

places.name: Venna Lake
places.description: A serene lake in Mahabaleshwar offering boating facilities and beautiful surrounding landscapes.

places.name: Kolhapur Palace (New Palace)
places.description: A magnificent palace built in the 19th century, showcasing a blend of Jain and Hindu architectural styles.

places.name: Mahalakshmi Temple
places.description: One of the Shakti Peethas dedicated to Goddess Mahalakshmi, known for its exquisite architecture.

places.name: Shaniwar Wada
places.description: The historical fortified residence of the Peshwas, with magnificent gates and courtyards.

places.name: Aga Khan Palace
places.description: A historical building that served as a prison for Mahatma Gandhi and other freedom fighters during India's independence struggle.

places.name: Sinhagad Fort
places.description: A historic hill fortress that has witnessed many battles, offering panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

places.name: Trimbakeshwar Temple
places.description: One of the 12 Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva, featuring ancient architecture and religious significance.

places.name: Sula Vineyards
places.description: India's first vineyard resort, offering wine tours, tastings, and beautiful views of the surrounding vineyards.

places.name: Panchakki
places.description: A 17th-century water mill known for its ingenious engineering system that used water energy to grind grain.

places.name: Daulatabad Fort
places.description: One of the most powerful forts in the medieval Deccan region, known for its complex defense systems.

places.name: Grishneshwar Temple
places.description: One of the 12 Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva, located near the Ellora Caves.

places.name: Kailasa Temple
places.description: The centerpiece of the Ellora Caves, considered one of the most remarkable cave temples in India, carved from a single rock.

places.name: Malshej Ghat
places.description: A scenic mountain passage in the Western Ghats, known for its lush green landscape and waterfalls during monsoon.

places.name: Amboli Ghat
places.description: A hill station in the Sahyadri Hills, famous for its biodiversity and waterfalls during the monsoon season.

places.name: Karla Caves
places.description: Ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves known for their intricate carvings and large prayer hall.

places.name: Bhaja Caves
places.description: A group of 22 rock-cut caves dating back to the 2nd century BC, featuring Buddhist stupas and viharas.

places.name: Tiger Point
places.description: A scenic viewpoint offering spectacular panoramic views of the valley, especially beautiful during sunset.
